body:
Comment 2: 
Now, with GOGC=off

methodology: 

% for j in {1..10} ; do (5g stack.go ; 5l stack.5 ; for i in {1..100} ; do GOGC=off
./5.out 2>&1 ; if [ $? -ne 0 ] ; then echo "FAIL $i" ; else echo "PASS $i" ; fi ; done)
> ~/stack-nogc.out$j ; done

summary:


 % grep -c FAIL stack-gogc-off.out*
stack-gogc-off.out1:4
stack-gogc-off.out10:1
stack-gogc-off.out2:1
stack-gogc-off.out3:1
stack-gogc-off.out4:0
stack-gogc-off.out5:3
stack-gogc-off.out6:3
stack-gogc-off.out7:5
stack-gogc-off.out8:2
stack-gogc-off.out9:2
Attachments: 1. stack-gogc-off.out1 (38804 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out2 (10295 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out3 (10388 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out4 (792 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out5 (29485 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out6 (29376 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out7 (48492 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out8 (19991 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out9 (19798 bytes) 1. stack-gogc-off.out10 (10295 bytes)
